intro: Aspidostemon capuronii, commonly known as the Capuron's aspidostemon, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. It is a herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
